message.content: This question requires some basic knowledge about nocturnal animals. Nocturnal animals are animals that are active during the night and sleep during the day. Among the options provided, the snowy owl is the only animal that is known to be primarily active during the night. Option (A) is incorrect because bull sharks are not specifically known for being active during the night. Option (C) is incorrect because prairie dogs are diurnal, meaning they are active during the day. Option (D) is incorrect because there is no such thing as a spotted giraffe.

This question requires basic knowledge about animal behavior and their adaptations to different environments. The correct answer is option (B), the snowy owl. Snowy owls are nocturnal animals that are most active during the night when the sun is down. They have adapted to have excellent night vision and hearing, allowing them to hunt and thrive in the darkness. Option (A), the bull shark, is incorrect because bull sharks are not specifically adapted to thrive during nighttime. Option (C), the prairie dog, is diurnal and is most active during the day. Option (D), the spotted giraffe, is not a real animal, so it is incorrect.
